description: go.talks/present: Only pull in play.js if play is enabled.

messages.text:
I noticed this when doing an edit-save-reload cycle. The terminal
running present gets a flood of errors like
  2013/01/21 12:21:30 open play.js: no such file or directory

Since I'm running it with -play=false, I presume /play.js is not being
served, in which case the script tag should not be emitted.

Hello adg (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.talks

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=af545e29be48&repo=talks ***

go.talks/present: Only pull in play.js if play is enabled.

R=adg
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7098071

subject: code review 7098071: go.talks/present: Only pull in play.js if play is enabled.
